page.title: 17ANIMALS (WILD)
page.content: The rivers farmland and woods of the area provide habitat for many types of animals. There is one known family of Badgers resident in the area. Foxes travel in and out of the area , a fair estimate would be 4 at any given time. Red Squirrels inhabit the woods the expanding population of Grey Squirrels has not reached this area yet. There are about 4 Ror Deer but like the foxes others come and go. Mink,which originally escaped from a Mink farm are a nuisance along the rivers because they kill water birds. The Eckford Gamekeeper destroyed 27 in 1984,27 in 1985,14 in 1986 and estimate that 6 remain. The countryside sustains average numbers of weasels,stoats,moles, rabbits and hedgehogs and small rodents.
